TI: [Significance of the hippocampus in the development of convulsive syndrome by kindling electrostimulation of the caudate nucleus].
AB: The experiments were conducted on rabbits with chronically implanted electrodes (neocortex, hippocampus, amygdala, caudate nucleus). The rostral part of caudate nucleus was stimulated once daily at a current maximum 300 microA, using 60 Hz square pulses (1.0 Ms) 12.0 s in duration. The severity of motor seizures and its developmental velocity were studied in the relation with a degree of the epileptization of the brain. The data obtained illustrated the next relation: the more stable and intensive were discharges in hippocampus the harder motor seizures.
TT: Znachenie gippokampa v razvitii sudorozhnogo sindroma pri kindling-elektrostimuliatsiiakh khvostatogo iadra.
